intro: Boerhavia schinzii f. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf boerhavia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Nyctaginaceae. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, contributing to its ornamental value. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance, it is often cultivated as a hardy ground cover or in xeriscaped gardens.
